channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Recycling overflowing yet again, 6th July
item.description:
This constantly needs sorting out. There is clearly more demand than supply for textile recycling.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Red Post Hill, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Neighbour burning toxic materials, 6th July
item.description:
A neighbour, four flats down from me (I am at 156B graham road) has created a big fire in her garden and is burning rubbish in her garden which is creating toxic fumes. There is black smoke billowing from the fire - it is not safe!
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Graham Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trip problem. Broken kerb, 6th July
item.description:
Outside House 3 &5 the drop kerb has been broken and it moves not only when cars use this bit as a road and makes a loud knocking noise but walking hazard for pedestrians as it is raised. A few people have tripped over at this location already.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rainbow Road, Slade Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown bushes on the pavement, 6th July
item.description:
The bushes near midfield bus stop N and opposite to Grays Farm primary school is over grown making it dangerous to walk on the pavement near the road especially with the kids. Please take action quickly thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sevenoaks Way, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Trees are almost completely obstructing the footpath, 6th July
item.description:
Trees are overgrown and obstructing the path. They block out the streetlights at night which is a security risk. Cannot easily pass on a bike as such a narrow path left due to trees

item.title: Litter accumulating within tree protection screening, 6th July
item.description:
Please, Islington Council, provide an opening at the bottom of the metallic screening around trees for the removal of litter which people put in through the open top. It's so ugly to see litter accumulating outside this large impressive office building named 160 Old St, and I know this exists widely around when the public is given no chance to remove it nor do council street cleaning staff do anything about it. The same problem exists in Hackney, where I live.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 160, Old Street, Finsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Food left all over bench, thrown behind fence where bench is and by tree, 6th July
item.description:
Street needs cleaning from food all dropped. And behind fence where bench is. Food everywhere

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 43, Carlton Vale, Kensal Town, London
